definitions.definition: a section of a piece of writing, usually consisting of several sentences dealing with a single subject. The first sentence of a paragraph starts on a new line.

examples.text: Write a paragraph on each of the topics given below.
The basic idea is summarized in the following paragraphs.
The opening paragraph sets the scene very well.
The identity of the murderer is revealed in the very last paragraph.
This is the key paragraph in the article.

wordOrigin: late 15th cent.: from French paragraphe, via medieval Latin from Greek paragraphos ‘short stroke marking a break in sense’, from para- ‘beside’ + graphein ‘write’.
